div.l: Ful pale he wex for dronken̄ and not rede
He ȝoxes and he spekes þorgh his nose
As he wer͗e on þe quake or on þe pose
To bedde he goeth and with him his wife
As ony Iay he was light and Iolife
So was þeir͗e ioli whistell wel I wette
Þe cradell bi hir͗e beddis side was sette
To rok and to gyue þe childe suke
And whan þat dronken̄ was alphyn̄ þe croke
To bedde went þe dought̉er right a none
To bedde goeth Aleyn̄ and also Iohn
Ther͗e was nore þer͗e nedez hem to dwale
Þis Miller hath so wisely bibbed ale
That as an horse he routed in his slepe
Ne of his taile behinde he toke no kepe
His wife bar͗e him a burdoıı̄un wel stronge
Men might hem her͗e rowting half a forlonge
Þe wenche routed eke ꝑpar company
Aleyn þe clerk þat herd þis melody
He ploked Iohn he seid slepest thou
Herdest thou euer suche a song or nowe
Lo suche a complyng is a mong hem all
A wilde fir͗e on hir͗e bodies fall
Who herd euer suche a ferly thing
Ye þei shal haue þe floure of euel endyng
Al þis longe night þere tide me no rest
But yit no force all shal be for þe best
For Iohn seid he as euer mote I thrive
If þat I may yone wenche wol I swife
Some esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn þer͗e is a lawe þat seith thus
That if a man in oon pointe be a greued Qui in vno aggᵃrauatʳur
That in a noþer he shal be releued In alio debet releuari
Oure corn̄ is stolen sothli it is no nay
And we haue hadde an euel fit to day
And sith I shal haue non amendement
Agayne my lost I will haue my esement
Bi goddꝭes soule it shal non oþer be
Iohn seid Aleyn̄ avise the
Þe Miller is a ꝑperlious man he seid
And if he oute of his slepe abraid
He might do vs both a vilany
Aleyn̄ answhered I counte hīm not a flye
